intro: Chevaliera magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalena's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often hairy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
